Support :

'''Attention+++ :'''

- '''prevention of rhesus alloimmunisation'''-D

- Importance of ''information'' given to the patient - ''reassurance''.

- Psychological care offered

After discussion with the patient, it is possible to consider expulsion of the terminated pregnancy. Two methods are possible:

- medical treatment (prostaglandins) for small bags and minor haemorrhages

- surgical treatment'' in other cases.

- hospitalisation, pre-operative assessment and anaesthetic consultation

- under general or local anaesthetic

- dilatation of the cervix, aspiration with a cannula + anatomopathological examination of the aspiration product

- Checking uterine vacuity on ultrasound

- out the same day or the following day.

question.question: What is the recommended treatment for a first-trimester miscarriage?

options.title: Option A: Medical treatment for small bags and minor haemorrhages
options.description: This is the recommended method for mild cases of miscarriage.

options.title: Option B: Hospitalisation, pre-operative assessment and anaesthetic consultation
options.description: This is the recommended method for severe cases of miscarriage.

options.title: Option C: Prostaglandins for small bags and minor haemorrhages
options.description: Prostaglandins are sometimes used to manage mild miscarriage.

options.title: Option D: Surgical treatment for uterine vacuity on ultrasound
options.description: Surgical treatment is not typically recommended for uterine vacuity on ultrasound.

question.correct_option: Option A: Medical treatment for small bags and minor haemorrhages
